content.raw: Why are frames #1 and #2 the same for these logs but not the 3rd one? Is is the issue with the first sample being a snapshot of the world?
content.html: Why are frames #1 and #2 the same for these logs but not the 3rd one? Is is the issue with the first sample being a snapshot of the world?

content.raw: Maybe store the shasums in variables so it's clear that they are the same? Like this one for the end, the one for start, the one for 30.0 shows up twice...
content.html: Maybe store the shasums in variables so it's clear that they are the same? Like this one for the end, the one for start, the one for 30.0 shows up twice...

content.raw: Maybe check something like `EXPECT_EQ(player->GetLogStartTime(), common::Time(28.465));`
content.html: Maybe check something like EXPECT_EQ(player->GetLogStartTime(), common::Time(28.465));

content.html: I didn't understand what this means. You step back 284 times and go back to where you were?

content.raw: Do we still need to have `targetSimTime` as a member variable? It's only used here. Maybe we can get rid of it the same way `seekPending` was removed.
content.html: Do we still need to have targetSimTime as a member variable? It's only used here. Maybe we can get rid of it the same way seekPending was removed.

content.raw: No, it shouldn't but that part was missing. We need to fix more things to make the insertions/deletions work.
content.html: No, it shouldn't but that part was missing. We need to fix more things to make the insertions/deletions work.

content.raw: Got it, thanks.
content.html: Got it, thanks.

content.raw:
1. `Forward()` moves you to the very end of the log file.
1. You step back for visualizing the last sample.
content.html:
1. Forward() moves you to the very end of the log file.
  2. You step back for visualizing the last sample.

content.raw: Should insertions and deletions be working now? It seems that insertions are working only when playing the log in a sequence, without skipping to the middle. And deletions don't seem to be working at all.
content.html: Should insertions and deletions be working now? It seems that insertions are working only when playing the log in a sequence, without skipping to the middle. And deletions don't seem to be working at all.

content.raw: Does this mean it forwards to the last sample and goes back one?
content.html: Does this mean it forwards to the last sample and goes back one?

content.raw: Thanks. We probably also need to update the [tutorial](http://gazebosim.org/tutorials?tut=install_from_source&ver=default&cat=install) on how to build default. It might require a pull request to [release-tools](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/release-tools/pull-requests/).
content.html: Thanks. We probably also need to update the tutorial on how to build default. It might require a pull request to release-tools.

content.raw:
Yes, `sudo apt-get install libtinyxml2-dev`

Description updated.
content.html:
Yes, sudo apt-get install libtinyxml2-dev

Description updated.

update.description:
This pull requests improves the overall speed of log playback and test coverage.

* It uses `tinyxml2` in LogPlayback instead of `tinyxml`.
* Adds some new functions to `LogPlay` class: stepback, multi-step, forward, seek.

How to test it:

1. `sudo apt-get install libtinyxml2-dev`
2. Log a long Gazebo log file (+10mins).
3. Close Gazebo and open it again playing back the log file.
4. Play with the log controllers (multi-step, rewind, forward, drag and drop the temporal cursor (seek)).

Everything should be faster than before.

CI results:

* [nogpu happy](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-any-devel-trusty-amd64-no-gpu/729/)
* [Mac OS X pending](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/gazebo/job/gazebo-any-devel-homebrew-amd64/554/)
* [trusty nvidia pending](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/gazebo/job/gazebo-any-devel-trusty-amd64-gpu-nvidia/550/)
update.title: Logging - part2

content.raw: It says I'm missing `tinyxml2`, is there something I need to do beforehand?
content.html: It says I'm missing tinyxml2, is there something I need to do beforehand?

content.raw: Waiting for Jenkins to see if 2d3f2a0 fixes the issue.
content.html: Waiting for Jenkins to see if 2d3f2a0 fixes the issue.
